View My Alerts IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE As requested your News Alert for TXN follows from Eq uityAlertcom Texas Instruments Unveils Industrys Highest Performance Audio Volume Control IC for Professional Audio Systems TUCSON Ariz Oc t PRNewswire via COMTEX Designed for a wide variety of profes sional recording and playback applications Texas Instruments NYSE TXN TI introduced the industrys highest performance audio volume control IC Integrated Circuit from the companys BurrBrown products division Featur ing dB dynamic range percent distortion THDN dB intercha nnel crosstalk and V analog power supplies the PGA improves syst em performance in professional audio applications such as digital mixing co nsoles multitrack recorders broadcast studio equipment highend AV rec eivers effects processors musical instruments and highend car audio sys tems See scaapu Building on BurrBrowns audio expertise and history of highperformance components the new PGA stan ds as the highestperformance audio volume control device on the market s aid Mike Centorino professional audio marketing manager at TIs BurrBrown division The PGA is a highperformance digitallycontrolled analog audio volume control which offers independent control over two audio channe ls via a serial control interface Other features include a wide gain and a ttenuation range of dB to dB with dB steps zero crossing dete ction and a mute function The PGA operates from V analog power s upplies enabling the device to process large signals inputoutput voltage range of Vpp thereby preserving the dynamic range available in the ove rall signal path Incorporating internal highperformance operational amp lifiers the PGA yields low noise and distortion while providing the ca pability to drive large loads ohm directly without buffering A three wire serial control interface allows for connection to a variety of host c ontrollers and also supports daisy chaining of multiple PGA devices Available Today The PGA is available now in SOL and DIP package s Suggested resale pricing starts at in piece quantities Te xas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processi ng and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instru ments is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN More i nformation is View My Alerts IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE As requested your News Alert for TXN follows from Eq uityAlertcom TI Introduces Worlds First V Logic Family for Portab le Consumer Electronics Telecommunications and ComputingDFamily Extends Battery Life Simplifies Design Process and Increases Data Throughput DA LLAS Oct PRNewswire via COMTEX Texas Instruments NYSE TXN TI today introduced a new logic family Advanced UltraLow Voltage CMOS AUC which are optimized at V but are operational to sub V levels T he AUC family provides significant benefits to portable consumer electronic s computing and telecom applications by operating at low power and high sp eed while maintaining overall system signal integrity See wwwticomsca uc The family consists of Little Logic singledualtriple gates octa ls and WideBustm devices All devices are optimized at V and have an operating voltage range of V to V With a voltage tolerance of V AUC extends the life of systems by allowing legacy devices to remain fun ctional In addition the subV feature allows AUC to be operated by a si ngle cell battery AUC also includes Ioff which protects the device by sup porting partial power down applications TI has been working closely with Philips and IDT to develop the specifications for the new AUC family Init ially TI will release Little Logic and Philips will offer an alternate sou rce Subsequently in IDT Philips and TI will release Octals and Wi deBus devices Based on this collaboration alternate source agreements are in place TI continues to take the logic market into new areas by devel oping leading technologies and innovative products The introduction of the new AUC family enables customers to gain higher performance as they move t o the lower voltage node DSPs and highperformance analog ICs said David Hoover worldwide product marketing manager for TIs Standard Linear and Lo gic Products In addition optimizing the family at V extends battery life while also speeding up data throughput in the system Little Logic AUC The AUC family is available in singledualtriple gate devices for po rtable consumer electronics Consistent with the family the Little Logic A UC devices are optimized at V while maintaining high speed and low noi se Essential to the success of portable consumer applications the devices extend battery life while maintaining very good signal integrity The Litt le Logic devices will be available in various packaging options including NanoStartm packaging the worlds smallest logic package Philips foc us on providing leading Pico Gate solutions for the consumer networking a nd communications markets makes the alternate source agreement for AUC tech nology a perfect match said Bruce Potvin director of marketing logic pro ducts Working with TI we are able to deliver a true alternate source for AUC Little Logic devices that offer highperformance industry leading sol utions WidebusOctal AUC For telecommunications and computing applica tions the AUC family of devices offer high speed data throughput and enhan ced signal integrity that is critical to performance Speed for the Widebus devices is a very fast ns ns typical The V provides a logic migration for lower operating voltages and simplifies the system design l earning curve The AUC family enhances IDTs highperformance low voltag e logic portfolio by enabling us to keep pace with the industry as custome rs migrate to lower operating nodes said Kevin Walsh director of strateg ic marketing for IDTs Timing and Logic Division As a company strongly fo cused on communications we believe it is important to use our digital desi gn expertise to be a leader in product innovation By collaborating with TI and others we ensure that these nextgeneration devices will provide the necessary performance nodes of operation and feature set for our networki ng and communications customer base Availability Packaging and Pricing The first Little Logic devices in the AUC family are sampling now with v olume production scheduled for the first quarter of Estimated resale pricing for the Little Logic devices begins at for quantities greater than Devices in Little Logic are available in NanoStar packaging S C DCK and SOT DBV AUC NanoStar will be available in H Wid eBus and Octal devices are available in Q The AUC family is fully suppo rted with technical documentation Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and analog technologies the semi conductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also includ e sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is h eadquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instruments is traded on View My Alerts IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE As requested your News Alert for TXN follows from Eq uityAlertcom Earnings And Option Expiration Will Drive The Markets On Friday Commentary Part RealTimeTraderscom As we anticipated t he broad market was quite weak throughout Thursdays session This was evid ent by the sharp disparity between the number of advancing issues and decli ning issues on both markets However thanks to the strength in few technolo gy stocks the Nasdaq Composite managed to hold its ground and finish in th e positive territory up points at The Dow Industrials lost almost points and closed at and the broader S index lost points a nd closed at Note that from a technical perspective both the Dow and the S indices have now broken their recent uptrend Thursday after the close a slew of companies reported their quarterly reports that once again painted a mixed picture about future earnings Dow Component Microsoft Cor p MSFT reported better than expected revenues but lower net profits and also warned second quarter and full year earnings would be below street es timates On this news the stock traded slightly lower in after hours On th e other hand PeopleSoft Inc PSFT reported better than expected results on increased revenues and earnings From all the earnings reports released thus far it seems some of the sectors may be starting to see signs of sta bilization but almost none seem to be able to predict when an upturn could occur in their respective industries Following are some of the companies worth watching that reported their results after the close CA KLAC EMLX NT GLW SUNW GTW SFA AMCC TQNT IDTI XLNX and EBAY Given the mixed earnings picture it is difficult to anticipate how the markets will react on Friday morning However the momentum is certainly on the downside due to option expirations and the fact traders are still unwilling to hold posi tions over the weekend due to continued concerns about Americas new war on Terrorism We will continue to monitor the markets throughout the session and alert investors and traders to the overall market conditions and to the best and worst performing sectors Copyrightc View My Alerts IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE As requested your News Alert for TXN follows from Eq uityAlertcom TI Adds Several New DesignWins Providing HighPerforma nce Programmable DSPs To an EverGrowing Array of Internet Audio Products DNine of the Top Consumer Electronics Manufacturers Choose TIs DSPs F or Internet Audio Devices DALLAS Oct PRNewswire via COMTEX Continuing to demonstrate its strong support of the Internet audio industr y Texas Instruments Incorporated NYSE TXN TI added new products from GGKaiser and SONICblueTM Incorporated as well as additional products fro m current customers Compaq Computer Corporation and eDigital to its extens ive list of designwins Throughout TI has established strong relatio nships and demonstrated the ability to listen to our customers resulting in increased market share over the competition TIs awardwinning DSP techno logy has been designed into more than Internet audio devices including products from nine of the top consumer electronics manufacturers See h TI has its finger on the pulse of t he digital music industry with more than percent of the top consumer el ectronics manufacturers using our technology said Chris Schairbaum world wide marketing manager of Internet Audio at TI As we approach the holiday s TI expects to see an increase in consumer demand for upgradeable featur erich devices offering the flexibility to adjust to the everchanging audi o market TI is one of the leading suppliers of chips in the Internet au dio market having shipped three million Internet audio DSPs as of June more than any other programmable semiconductor manufacturer TI provides the engine for Internet audioenabled products from leading consumer elect ronics manufacturers due to its flexible high performance and low power sy stem solution TIs Internet Audio business garnered several new designwin s and industry relationships in the third quarter including August SONICblue selected TIs industryleading programmable DSP techn ology to power its new RioR One digital audio player Leveraging the performance headroom and programmability of TIs DSP the Rio One can play multiple audio formats is upgradeable to support fu ture formats and costs less than TIs lowpower DSP also en ables the Rio One to play up to hours of music on one AA batter y September TI was the first semiconductor company to license Thomsons new mpPRO digital audio format Using TIs in dustryleading programmable DSPs manufacturers will now have the ability to update Internet audio devices to support the mpPRO for mat Backwards compatible with mp the new mpPRO offers dramati cally improved compression rates and sound quality September U sing TIs TMSCx DSP GGKaiser has developed the MPKaiser a multiformat digital audio player that features wireless radio f requency technology allowing connectivity between the player and c ompatible wireless headphones car audio and home audio The MPK aiser features realtime mp encoding FMtuner and voicerecorder September In addition to the iPAQ Music Center that was annou nced in June Compaq Computer Corporation has incorporated TI DSPs into its iPAQ Personal CD Player PCD The PCD plays CDR CD RW and conventional CDs and supports mp and Windows Media Audio WMA files The PCD features an FMtuner connectivity to home stereo systems and an infrared remote control for ease of use W ith MB of memory listeners can enjoy up to songs or ho urs of audio from a single disk September eDigital i ncorporated the TI DSP into the first publicly available digital a udio reference design that supports DataPlay technology enabling manufacturers to easily incorporate this emerging storage medium DataPlay digital media is a universal solution about the size of a quarter that is designed to play and record all forms of digit al content across all digital devices and platforms including mus ic images software eBooks games video and more Octo ber eDigital has also utilized TIs DSP technology into its ne w digital audio and music playerrecorder which supports IBMs Mi crodrive removable hard disk media The new Microdrive technology allows up to GB of storage or hours of music Based on eDi gitals new MicroOS operating system the ultraportable produ ct features VoiceNav eDigitals natural speechrecognition user interface for performing navigation and playback functions Just i n time for the holidays consumers will have easy voice access to an extensive portable audio or music library About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and analog t echnologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys b usinesses also include sensors and controls and educational and EquityAlertcom Texas Instruments Introduces Inductorles s StepDown Charge Pumps for High Efficiency Ease of Use in BatteryOperat ed SystemsDDevices Offer Industry Leading Output Current Drive of mA DALLAS Nov PRNewswire via COMTEX A new family of stepdown charge pumps from Texas Instruments NYSE TXN TI brings power efficienc y and ease of use to batteryoperated systems and PC peripherals With its high output drive and builtin protection features the new charge pumps of fer savings in board space and system cost Being the first stepdown or buck charge pumps introduced by TI the new family of devices extends TI s comprehensive portfolio of powersupply solutions for lowvoltage applica tions including personal digital assistants and Internet audio players Se e powerticomaapu The new TPSx stepdown charge pumps offer regulated output voltages ranging from to volts V in order to pow er lowvoltage components in portable and buspowered systems The charge p umps take an input voltage range from V to V enabling use with a var iety of battery types Additionally a low quiescent current of only mic roamps uA allows for longer standby times At mA the family provides the highest output current in the industry and is capable of supporting mu ltiple components within a system Finally with the TPSx only four sm all ceramic capacitors are required to build a complete highefficiency cha rge pump power converter thereby saving board space and cost With the introduction of stepdown charge pumps TI expands its existing line of lin ear regulators and inductive stepdown converters offering a more complete selection of voltage regulator solutions said Guenter Sporer systems eng ineering manager for Low Power DCDC Converter Products at TI With lowvo ltage applications becoming more specialized customers know that they can rely on TI for power supply solutions that meet their system requirements Efficiency and Ease of Use The TPSx stepdown charge pumps offer o perating efficiencies comparable to inductive buck converters yet with the ease of use that is customary with linear regulators Peak efficiencies of percent are achieved by utilizing a fractional conversion topology resu lting in lower power dissipation and eliminating the need for heat sinking Supporting system flexibility the devices can be powered by three or four nickelcadmium NiCad nickelmetalhydride NiMH or alkaline batteries or by a single lithiumion Liion cell Requiring few external capacit ors and no inductors TPSx charge pumps simplify design and allow for a complete converter to be built in only square inches in To preve nt current leakage and prolong battery life the load is isolated from the battery during shutdown Added protection features include a soft start to limit inrush current a Power Good output voltage supervisor overtempera ture and overcurrent protection Available Today The TPSx stepdow n charge pumps are now available in a pin MSOP package from TI and TI au thorized distributors Suggested resale pricing is each in quantities of An evaluation module EVM is available today to help simplify s ystem design and speed time to market Regulated output voltages for the TP Sx devices are as follows TPS Adjustable V to V T PS Fixed V TPS Fixed V TPS Fixed V Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal pr ocessing and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educa tional and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas an d has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instruments is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN More information is located on the World Wide EquityAlertcom Zingy to Serve Up Ringtones and Other Mo bile Phone Stuff for Pepsistuffcom PromotionDZingy Teams With Pepsi an d Yahoo to Provide Wireless Entertainment Content For Successful Online Pr omotion NEW YORK Nov PRNewswire via COMTEX Zingy a wirele ss entertainment portal geared to teens and young adults today announced t hat it will provide ringtones and logos for mobile phones as part of the su ccessful Pepsistuffcom promotion now underway Zingy will distribute dozen s of specially created ringtones and logos including songs by Britney Spea rs at Pepsistuffcom and Dewstuffcom until the promotion ends January Players can purchase any of the billion ounce and liter bottles andor fountain cups of Pepsi Diet Pepsi Pepsi ONE Mountain Dew Wild Cherry Pepsi Mug Root Beer and Orange Slice with a special Pepsistu ffcom powered by Yahoo logo on the cap They then log onto Pepsistuffc om or Dewstuffcom set up a Yahoo account and enter the unique digit a lphanumeric code found on the cap Pepsistuffcom will tell you what each c ode is worth or award merchandise instantly Players can redeem points for ringtones logos or other forms of digital music digital awards or online retailer discounts Mobile phones are increasingly becoming a way for u s to showcase our own unique personalities said Zingy founder and CEO Fab rice Grinda Oneofa kind ringtones and logos will make a pitchperfect addition to the big name merchandise available at Pepsistuffcom Zingy s youthoriented mobile content and delivery method hits the Pepsistuffco m target dead on said Frances Britchford vp of innovation at PepsiCola North America This is a huge promotion that harnesses the online world an d fully engages teenagers About Pepsi Headquartered in Purchase NY PepsiCola North America is the beverage division of PepsiCo Inc wwwpepsicocom in the United States and Canada Its b rands in the US include Pepsi Diet Pepsi Pepsi ONE Pepsi Twist Mounta in Dew Mountain Dew Code Red Mug Sierra Mist Slice Wild Cherry Pepsi Aquafina FruitWorks and SoBe The company also makes and markets North Ame ricas No readytodrink iced teas and coffees respectively via joint ventures with Lipton and Starbucks comprehensive wireless entertainment portal in the US geared to th e unique wireless personalization communication and entertainment needs of teens and young adults Wireless entertainment a billion EquityAlertcom OpenVoB Successfully Completes CallFests III IV Participating Vendors Recognized for Superior Effort and Equipmen tDAvail Networks Broadcom General Bandwidth Intel Ishoni Networks Me taSwitch Texas Instruments and Xavi Test StandardsBased Deployment Models for Interoperable Voice Over Broadband Services RICHARDSON Texas Nov BUSINESS WIRE OpenVoBtm the industry consortium dedicated t o accelerating the deployment of VoiceoverBroadband wwwopenvoborg to day announced the success of the groups third and fourth CallFeststm mu ltivendor interoperability test events held Oct and Nov at the University of New Hampshire InterOperability Laboratory in Durham NH These CallFests focused on interoperability between multiple voice gateway and integrated access devices IADs based on the ATM Forums Loop Emulation Services LES voice over AAL specification The testing was don e to address provisioning and management of the IADs based on the ATM Forum s recently released LES EOCMIB specification CallFests form a critical step in the mass deployment of voice over broadband services Testing of t he LES EOCMIB specification will ultimately enable service providers to su pport flow through provisioning of new services In a network able to sup port flowthrough provisioning an order is entered by a customer service r epresentative on the topmost system and it flows through all other inte rmediate systems finally affecting the configuration of the network to set up an endtoend circuit Provisioning is automated reducing costs and er rors Flowthrough provisioning ensures that the cost of provisioning a der ived voice line will not be higher than the costs of a POTS circuit nor as error prone as manual provisioning CallFest III and IV were largely suc cessful because of the dedication and commitment shown by the members and e quipment vendors that were present stated Paul Drew OpenVoB Technical Ed itor and Interoperability manager We are enthusiastic about the progress that we have made and look forward to future CallFests and assisting the st andards bodies in advancing the rollout of voice over broadband technology OpenVoB is working with the University of New Hampshires InterOperabi lity Laboratory to establish an ongoing interoperability testing network w ithin their labs which has been made possible through the generous support of leading access network and testing vendors including Cisco Systems Ligh tStream ATM Switch Avail Networks Frontera SHDSL Access Switch Sage Instruments AT Voice Quality Tester Malden Electronics DSLA Speech Performance Measurement System RADCOM ATM Protocol Analyzer and Spirent Communications Abacus Class Switch Simulator The end product of the OpenVoB CallFest series is a set of validated implementation models and corresponding test plans that will be submitted to the appropriate sta ndards bodies to help accelerate the adoption and deployment of voice over broadband technology and services If you are interested in participating in upcoming CallFests or becoming a member of OpenVoB please send an ema il to About OpenVoB OpenVoB or Open Voice over Broadb and was formed to meet the expressed needs of service providers planning t o deploy voice over broadband services by facilitating multivendor system level interoperability of packetized voice services based on existing and emerging industry specifications The group leverages a cooperative enginee ring approach to create deployment models and test plans that enable and pr omote the development of interoperable gateways IADs softswitches and oth er VoB products from multiple vendors Current broadbandenabling member companies of the OpenVoB include Wire Accelerated Networks NasdaqACCL Accordion Networks ADTRAN NasdaqADTN Atlantic Telecom Avail Networks Broadcom Corporation NasdaqBRCM Brecis Communications Convergent Net works Efficient Networks General Bandwidth GlobeSpan NasdaqGSPN Inte gral Access Intel NasdaqINTC ipVerse Ishoni Networks MetaSwitch Net opia NasdaqNTPA Polycom NasdaqPLCM Rapid Networks Santera Systems Sphere Communications Texas Instruments Telogy Networks NasdaqTXN V INA Technologies NasdaqVINA and Xavi Members of OpenVoB have drafted a white paper that outlines the pressing need for this organization and pre sents a road map detailing the steps the group is taking to reach its prima ry objectives The white paper can be found on the OpenVoB Web site http wwwopenvoborg which also hosts a wealth of information about the OpenV oB organization FAQs online technical discussion groups and other resourc es For more information about becoming a member of OpenVoB please email CONTACT OpenVoB Tabitha Bai ley URL Todays News On The Net Business Wires full file on the Internet with EquityAlertcom JD Power and Associates and Yahoo Inc Report Travelers Strongly Prefer Federal Involvement in Airport Security Screening Process AGOURA HILLS Calif Nov BUSINESS WIRE As the busiest holiday travel period approaches consumers are still planni ng to increase air travel Last weeks crash of Flight did not dramatic ally reduce confidence in air travel however travelers want more federal involvement in security measures according to the JD Power and Associate s and Yahoo Inc NasdaqYHOO report released today Among those who ha ve traveled within the last three months percent of air travelers say t hey are already comfortable with air travel This same group reports the level of travelers reporting they will never be comfortable rose from p ercent to percent The report shows being afraid to fly is still the most oftencited reason for curtailing air travel plans with nearly per cent of leisure travelers mentioning it as their number one reason Onethi rd of business travelers cited either economic conditions or company restri ctions on air travel as their top reasons for not flying Travelers have a strong preference for federal involvement in the airport security screeni ng process according to the report The highly publicized recent storie s of security lapses have greatly reduced the publics opinion of private a irport security companies said Michael Taylor director of travel service s at JD Power and Associates The public also feels stronger that a sear ch of checked baggage is necessary for airport security One thing that hasnt changed in the past month is the publics faith in technology to pro vide greater security Hightech scanners and bomb sniffers top the list of items travelers would like to see in airports A ban on restaurant cutle ry and national ID cards have the least impact on how safe consumers feel As for what can be done to increase inflight security armored cockpit doors would inspire as much confidence as sky marshals posted on random fli ghts said Taylor The percentage of people that feel air travel has ch anged forever is slowly dropping while the percentage of people perceivin g no difference increased from percent to percent The Flight tr agedy did not affect the percentage of travelers who are still undecided ab out their comfort level in flying which remained steady at one in five tra velers The survey was conducted two months after the worst air catastrop hes in the history of the United States September and one day after th e crash of Flight JD Power and Associates and Yahoo collected data from more than adult respondents The public opinion poll was conduct ed among random visitors to Yahoos Web site the week of November More than of the respondents reported having air travel experiences within the past three months Headquartered in Agoura Hills Calif JD Power and Associates is a global marketing information services firm operating i n key business sectors including market research forecasting consulting training and customer satisfaction The firms quality and satisfaction mea surements are based on actual responses from millions of consumers annually JD Power and Associates can be accessed through the Internet at wwwjdp acom Media email contact or michael d pacom Yahoo Inc is a leading global Internet communications commerce and media company that offers a comprehensive branded network of services to more than million individuals each month worldwide Yahoo is the No Internet brand globally and reaches the largest audience worldwide The companys global Web network includes world properties Yahoo has offi ces in Europe Asia Latin America Australia Canada and the United States and is headquartered in Sunnyvale Calif This press release is provide d for editorial use only No advertising or other promotional use can be ma de of the information in this release or JD Power and Associates survey r esults without the express prior written consent of JD Power and EquityAlertcom QUALCOMM Enters into CDMA Subscriber Uni t License and Technology Transfer Agreement with TCL Holdings Co SAN DIE GO Nov BUSINESS WIRE QUALCOMM Incorporated Nasdaq QCOM p ioneer and world leader of Code Division Multiple Access CDMA digital wir eless technology and TCL Holdings Co Ltd a large scale leading Chinese enterprise today announced that they have signed a commercial subscriber u nit license and technology transfer agreement Under the terms of the world wide royaltybearing license agreement QUALCOMM has granted TCL Holdings a license under QUALCOMMs CDMA patent portfolio to develop manufacture an d sell cdmaOneTM and thirdgeneration G CDMA XxEV subscriber eq uipment Additionally TCL Holdings has entered into a multimillion dollar CDMA X design technology transfer agreement for QUALCOMMs developmen t and design of CDMA X subscriber unit equipment QUALCOMM is pleas ed to welcome TCL Holdings as they are the first company in China to sign a G CDMA X handset design transfer agreement with QUALCOMM TCL Holdi ngs strong leadership position and technical expertise will allow them to contribute significantly to the growth of the CDMA market said Paul Jacob s group president of QUALCOMM Wireless and Internet Group We look forwar d to providing technical assistance to support TCL Holdings efforts in dep loying and rolling out cdmaOne and G wireless communications products for the China marketplace TCL Holdings is glad to enter into a commercial subscriber unit license and design technology transfer agreement with QUALC OMM who is recognized as the world leader in CDMA technology products and solutions said Dr MingJian Wan president of TCL Mobile Communications As a leading handset manufacturer among Chinese domestic players TCL is c ommitted to enhancing its CDMA product offerings and looks forward to worki ng with QUALCOMM to help promote and drive the worldwide adoption of CDMA This agreement will allow us to accelerate the development of CDMA subscrib er unit equipment and meet the growing demand for innovative advanced yet costeffective wireless devices in China TCL Holdings Co Ltd wwwt clcom is a large scale leading
